reviews.text: I have the pleasure at staying at this hotel several times a month for business. I have tried others in the area but this is truely the best deal, location, cleanliness, and personallity. The staff here goes above and beyond to make sure your stay is perfect. They are super responsive to my needs and I always feel important. The hotel is very well laid out and spacious with updated technology in the rooms, especially Flat Screen TVs! I will continue to use this hotel as my main hub for my business travel.
reviews.title: A perfect experience everytime

reviews.text: This property is two years old and is very clean. The rooms were spotless and quiet.
reviews.title: Reliable brand doesn't disappoint

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Typical of the Hampton Inns, breakfast is included. The quality of the hot breakfast is poor and the chain should investigate alternatives.
reviews.title: Great place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall this is a dependable place to stay.
reviews.title: It's worth it!!

reviews.text: Really clean,really nice,near the Mohegan Sun Arena. Lots of places to eat and shop around.
reviews.title: Soooo Clean

reviews.text: If you are passing thru Wilkes-Barre, PA and need a place to stay, I highly recommend this Hampton Inn & Suites. My daughters and I were very impressed with the hospitality we received and the comfortable and contemporary look of this hotel which is only two years old. Our rooms were quite spacious with comfortable beds and furnished quite nicely. After checking into our rooms we received a call asking if everything was to our satisfaction and if we needed any assistance please let them know. This overture was appreciated. To add to our convenience were nearby restaurants and the fact that the hotel was also set back away from traffice and noise. Since we had a very early flight out of Scranton airport the next morning, to our surprise, there were on the go lunch bags filled with breakfast snacks for us and other travelers set up in the lobby area. Just another wonderful gesture we thought was a sign of hospitality that you do not see often in hotels these days. Overall, we rate this Hampton Inn & Suites a great place to stay!
reviews.title: "very impressed"
It's fine
reviews.text: Stayed just one night, and not much more than about 12 hours. Things started a little rocky as I was told to go to a certain room which was clearly occupied (thankfully the key didn't work). When I arrived in the room the heat was off so it was quite chilly. Also, after a long day of travel I wanted a beer but the hotel does not have a bar or any alcohol on premises.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the plus side, the room was spacious and comfortable. The next morning the breakfast was good. The business center did what I needed it to do. The front desk helped me get a cab and then arranged for the on-site shuttle to take me to the airport later. They were gracious when I asked to check out 30 minutes late.
reviews.title: Great place to stay, will be back, great rates for King-suite!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Agree with the prior comment that there was no street noise. Indeed, I wish the hotel were a little closer to the main street. It sits far back from the highway so while it seems like Starbucks or bars/restaurants are close, if you don't have a car, the hotel sits so far back (with a pointlessly winding drive), that the places might as well be forever away.
reviews.title: Average At Best

reviews.text: Anyway, the hotel was fine. If in the area again, I presume I'd stay there.
reviews.title: A great place to stay

reviews.text: We stayed here for one night and had a very pleasant stay. The hotel, while set back from the main road a bit, is in a prime location if you're planning on attending a game or concert at the Mohegan Sun Arena or a visit to the casino, both which are just up the road. Also just across the street are stores and restaurants. It's very convenient. It's also located just off major highways. I would recommend this Hampton Inn and would definitely stay here again. The staff was very courteous and the property itself is very nice.
reviews.title: Nice, Clean, Bright, New Hotel

reviews.text: Clean, very nice room, lots of space, great continental breakfast, friendly staff, close to Mohegan Sun Casino and more stores and shopping than I had time and money for. Plus there are tons of restaurants to choose from. This would be a good place to do an overnight with my adult kids.
reviews.title: Nice, clean hotel near lots of shopping and casino.

reviews.text: Stayed overnight while driving by, friendly staff, clean.
reviews.title: Excellent Stopover
very happy
reviews.text: Very close to the highway but noise was not an issue.
Good standard Hampton breakfast included.
reviews.title: Easy Hotel for Business Travel

reviews.text: The hotel was very clean and comfortable. We really enjoyed the pool. Breakfast was a nice way to start the day. First time at this hotel and we will return in the future.
reviews.title: Clean and comfortable

reviews.text: Clean and comfortable. Quick check-in and centrally located. My only complaint was not being able to find the hotel or road in my GPS. The staff was very helpful directing me to an address within sight of the hotel.
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable, good location

reviews.text: Stopped here on the way home from Florida. Very clean, staff very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was very good. We will stay here again the next time we are in Wilkes-Barre.
reviews.title: Good for an over night stop

reviews.text: The cleanest Hampton I've stayed at. Staff was extremely helpful and the breakfast was excellent. I wouldn't stay anywhere else while in Wilkes-Barre.
reviews.title: Awesome!

reviews.text: In a nutshell, check in was fast and friendly; the King room was clean and of adequate size, the bed was comfortable. Morning breakfast is fine with decent tasting coffee, fruit, cereals, bagels, danish, etc available. Bob Evans is within walking distance. There is a Crackle Barrel and Red Robbin, Wal Mart, Chinese buffet restaurant across the street. There is no microwave in the room, but dining options are plentiful in the immediate area. I was in for just a night, so i didn't check for higher quality restaurants. Since this Hampton is just a few years old, the overall property looks fresh and well maintained.
reviews.title: Very good for a hotel of this stature
